subject: RE: [junit] Help Required
msgSnippet: You might also want to check out Test Mentor (www.javatesting.com), which enables non-programmers as well as programmers to develop and share unit-level tests.
messageBody:
You might also want to check out Test Mentor (www.javatesting.com), which
enables non-programmers as well as programmers to develop and share
unit-level tests. Also, SilverMark's Enhanced JUnit adds Test Mentor
technology on to JUnit that automates some test development tasks.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.javatesting.com

> -----Original Message-----
> From: james.dobson@... [mailto:james.dobson@...]
> Sent: Monday, August 05, 2002 10:18 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Help Required
>
>
> Hi Mary,
>
> www.junit.org would be a great start. I recommend clicking the Getting
> Started link.
>
> Also reading some of the articles located at this site will give you an
> insight into what JUnit is and where it came from. It's an
> excellent JUnit
> resource.
>
> Good luck, James
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: reji_i [mailto:reji_i@...]
> Sent: 05 August 2002 12:58
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Help Required
>
>
> Hi All,
>
> I joined a new company and they want me to have the skill set
> developed in junit. I have the experience in using testing tools like
> Silk Test and Winrunner. I would like to know how to start with
> learning this tool.
>
>
> Thanks well in advance.
>
>
> Cheers
> Mary
>
>
